intro: Oxypetalum henschenii, commonly known as the Henschen's oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant is shrub-like, with opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
